Overview.Summary: The 2024 Croatian parliamentary election (2,6,8) resulted in a third government led by pro-EU PM Plenkovic (2). Plenkovic's ruling center-right Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) won the most seats but failed to obtain a majority (10). The election was held on April 17, 2024 (2,6,8,10) and the final results were handed over to President Milanović on April 30, 2024 (9).

Timeline.Text: The ruling Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ), led by Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic, wins most seats in the parliamentary election.
Incumbent Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic claims victory in the Croatian parliamentary election.
The Chief Justice of the Supreme Court and President of the State Electoral Commission hands over the final results of the Croatian parliamentary election to President Milanović.
Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic secures a mandate to form a government.
The third government led by pro-EU Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic is formed in Croatia.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Croatian parliamentary election (17) took place on April 17, 2024 (1,7,17), with the Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) party's President Andrej Plenkovic securing a mandate to form a government (1). The governing conservative party won a highly contested election and formed a new government (6,18). The election marked a tilt to the right in another European Union nation (18) and was seen as a showdown between its two main political rivals (9). It was held on a Wednesday for the first time (17) and was considered a culmination of longstanding rivalry (15). The official campaign lasted from April 1 to 15 (9). The UK Parliamentary General Election was also held on July 4, 2024 (7,8,11,12,16,19), where the Labour Party won a landslide victory (9). The official campaign lasted from June 1 to July 3 (9).

Croatia's parliament dissolves in preparation for a parliamentary election later this year.

The UK Parliamentary General Election takes place, setting the return date for Parliament as July 9th.
What happens if the far right gains in EU elections? Katya Adler reports.
The UK Parliamentary General Election is held, with Keir Starmer winning a landslide victory and becoming British Prime Minister.
Croatia's conservatives believe they will soon form a majority government.
Croatia's governing conservatives convincingly win a highly contested parliamentary election, but will still need support from far-right groups to stay in power.
